oai_dc:dc.dc:title: New viaduct, Church Street, Nashville, Tenn., between 1915 and 1930
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of the Church Street viaduct right after completion between 1915 and 1930. This structure was built to carry car traffic over the railroad tracks. A new viaduct was built to replace this one in the 1990s. Forms part of the Norton Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Architecture; Transportation; Capital City; Downtown Nashville; Postcards--Tennessee--Nashville; Bridges--Tennessee--Nashville; Streets--Tennessee--Nashville; Automobiles--Tennessee--Nashville; Transportation--Tennessee--Nashville; Viaducts--Tennessee--Nashville; Lost architecture--Tennessee--Nashville
